newsitem.title: MEXICO: Europeans to invest in Mexico shoes, says industry.
newsitem.headline: Europeans to invest in Mexico shoes, says industry.

text.p: European footwear firms will invest with local makers to export to the European market, said an industry leader on Friday.

"Talks with three Spanish companies are at a very advanced stage and a joint investment agreement may be finalized in October," said Xochitl Calderon, vice-president for international relations at the National Manufacturing Industry Chamber.

Calderon spoke while announcing plans for Eurocentro, a trade fair to be run under the auspices of the European Union in Leon, a footwear manufacturing centre, between October 24 and 27. The event aims to attract investment and boost exports, she said.
Spanish firms to take part in Eurocentro include Flexor, Folques and Bolsas Sanchez, and Italian firms Motex, Stern, Sintpell plan to take part, among others, she added.
